Created an attachment (id=51593)
The error that might indirectly be the cause of the problem

The error message was : Unable to start subsystem factory Discovery
This seems to be a configuration problem. One of the subsystems seems not to start...

Created an attachment (id=51594)
A patch that fixes the problem

One corrupt subsystem should not cause the entire system to fail. 
(I tried the patch on the running system using the debugger hotswap capabilities)

Here's how I debugged the running eclipse: 
  http://michaelscharf.blogspot.com/2006/10/tip-debug-and-patch-at-runtime.html

And a flash demo (ok flash demos is my new toy, I can't resist ;-):
  http://www.scharf.gr/eclipse/tips/debug-a-running-eclipse/
Dave - not being able to create filters is a major issue. Since a patch is attached, we should look at this ASAP, thus I've set it to P1.

The problem is no longer reproducable with I20061007-1903 (supposedly since discovery was fixed for that build). Lowering severity and priority but not marking fixed, since there still is an issue with corrupt subsystems destabilizing the entire system.
The patch should be considered.

I just tried it with I20061007-1903 and I get exactly the same exceptions....

A general policy with extensions is: a misbehaving extension should not impact the stability of the rest of the system. Whenever code 'talks' to extensions it should assume that the extensions do not behave well...

Can you please do "Help > About Eclipse > Configuration Details > Copy to Clipboard", then paste into a file and attach the file with your config.

I suspect that the "discovery" plugin you are using is still old and not from I20061007-1903.
Added the check for a null subsystem configuration when resolving a proxy.
